newsitem.title: USA: Meridian says Q1 hurt by severe weather.
newsitem.headline: Meridian says Q1 hurt by severe weather.

text.p: Meridian Insurance Group Inc said lower first-quarter net income resulted primarily from higher catastrophe claims related to severe storms and tornadoes in Tennessee, Kentucky, and Indiana in March.
The company on Friday reported net income for the first quarter of $310,000 versus $595,000 a year ago.
Loss and loss adjustment expenses for the quarter grew to 79.9 percent of earned premiums, compared with 79.4 percent for the first quarter of 1996, the multi-line insurer said.

Revenues for the first quarter were $52.9 million, versus $41.4 million for the corresponding quarter last year. Higher revenues reflected the acquisition of Citizens Security Group, which was completed in July 1996. Excluding the acquisition, net premiums written increased about nine percent over 1996.

"Although a high level of weather-related catastrophe losses has depressed our earnings in recent quarters, we continue to make progress in the areas of premium growth and expense control," said chief executive Norma Oman.

"We have completed the integration of Citizens Security Group and are beginning to capitalize on synergies created by this acquisition. We also continue to look for other acquisition opportunities," Oman said.
